Event.name: Breaking_apart
Event.definition:
<def-root>A Whole breaks apart into Pieces, resulting in the loss of the Whole (and in most cases, no piece that has a separate function).
<ex><fex name="Whole">The plane</fex> <fex name="Manner">violently</fex> <t>broke apart</t> <fex name="Place">in mid-air</fex>.</ex>
<ex>And then, I finally realized that it must have been the case that <fex name="who">a meteorite</fex> <t>broke apart</t> <fex name="Pieces">into at least 3 large pieces</fex>.</ex>
Many of these verbs can also refer metaphorically to the breaking apart of institutions. (See the frame for "schism".)</def-root>

Arg.name: Whole
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Whole</fen> goes into <fen>Pieces</fen> which were not (necessarily) definable subparts prior to breaking.</def-root>

Arg.name: Pieces
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Pieces</fen> result from the breaking apart of the <fen>Whole</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Criterion
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element expresses a property of the Parts or components of the <fen>Whole</fen> which correlates with the locations (e.g.) of fragmentation on the <fen>Whole</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event or participants not covered by more specific Frame Elements.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the breaking apart takes place.w</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location at which the breaking apart takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action, event, or state that enables the event of breaking apart.
<ex>The crew donned immersion suits and abandoned ship into a life raft as their vessel <t>broke</t> <t>apart</t> <fex name="mea">by wave action</fex>. </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: break down.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come apart into small fragments.

lexUnit.name: shatter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: break suddenly and violently into pieces.

lexUnit.name: snap.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: break quickly, often with a sharp sound (into two or more pieces).

lexUnit.name: break.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain.

lexUnit.name: crumble.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to fall apart into small fragments
